intro: Scleria amphigaea var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in eastern North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowering stems are often reddish or purple, adding visual interest to its habitat. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
